verses.verse: Then they told <S%H5046><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Behold <S%H6430><s%>, the Philistines fight <S%H3898><s%> against Keilah <S%H7084><s%>, and they rob <S%H8154><s%> the threshingfloors <S%H1637><s%>.

Therefore David <S%H1732><s%> inquired <S%H7592><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Shall I go <S%H3212><s%> and strike <S%H5221><s%> these Philistines <S%H6430><s%>? And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto David <S%H1732><s%>, Go <S%H3212><s%>, and strike <S%H5221><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>, and save <S%H3467><s%> Keilah <S%H7084><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%>'s men <S%H582><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H3373><s%>, Behold, we be afraid here in Judah <S%H3063><s%>: how much more then if we come <S%H3212><s%> to Keilah <S%H7084><s%> against the armies <S%H4634><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>?

Then David <S%H1732><s%> inquired <S%H7592><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> yet again <S%H3254><s%>. And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> him and said <S%H559><s%>, Arise <S%H6965><s%>, go down <S%H3381><s%> to Keilah <S%H7084><s%>; for I will deliver <S%H5414><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> into your hand <S%H3027><s%>.

So David <S%H1732><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> to Keilah <S%H7084><s%>, and fought <S%H3898><s%> with the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>, and brought away <S%H5090><s%> their cattle <S%H4735><s%>, and struck <S%H5221><s%> them with a great <S%H1419><s%> slaughter <S%H4347><s%>. So David <S%H1732><s%> saved <S%H3467><s%> the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Keilah <S%H7084><s%>.

And it came to pass <S%H54><s%>, when Abiathar the son <S%H1121><s%> of Ahimelech <S%H288><s%> fled <S%H1272><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%> to Keilah <S%H7084><s%>, that he came down <S%H3381><s%> with an ephod <S%H646><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%>.

And it was told <S%H5046><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%> that David <S%H1732><s%> was come <S%H935><s%> to Keilah <S%H7084><s%>. And Saul <S%H7586><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, God <S%H430><s%> has delivered <S%H5234><s%> him into my hand <S%H3027><s%>; for he is shut in <S%H5462><s%>, by entering <S%H935><s%> into a town <S%H5892><s%> that has gates <S%H1817><s%> and bars <S%H1280><s%>.

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> called <S%H8085><s%> all the people <S%H5971><s%> together <S%H8085><s%> to war <S%H4421><s%>, to go down <S%H3381><s%> to Keilah <S%H7084><s%>, to besiege <S%H6696><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> that Saul <S%H7586><s%> secretly practised <S%H2790><s%> mischief <S%H7451><s%> against him <S%H559><s%>; and he said to Abiathar <S%H54><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%>, Bring here <S%H5066><s%> the ephod <S%H646><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>, O Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, your servant <S%H5650><s%> has certainly <S%H8085><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> that Saul <S%H7586><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> to Keilah <S%H7084><s%>, to destroy <S%H7843><s%> the city for my sake <S%H5892><s%>.

Will the men <S%H1167><s%> of Keilah <S%H7084><s%> deliver me up <S%H5462><s%> into his hand <S%H3027><s%>? will Saul <S%H7586><s%> come down <S%H3381><s%>, as your servant <S%H5650><s%> has heard <S%H8085><s%>? O Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, I beg you <S%H5046><s%>, tell your servant <S%H5650><s%>. And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, He will come down <S%H3381><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>, Will the men <S%H1167><s%> of Keilah <S%H7084><s%> deliver <S%H5462><s%> me and my men <S%H582><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%>? And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, They will deliver you up <S%H5462><s%>.

Then David <S%H1732><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%>, which were about six <S%H8337><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%>, arose <S%H6965><s%> and departed <S%H3318><s%> out of Keilah <S%H7084><s%>, and went <S%H1980><s%> wherever <S%H834><s%> they could go <S%H1980><s%>. And it was told <S%H5046><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%> that David <S%H1732><s%> was escaped <S%H4422><s%> from Keilah <S%H7084><s%>; and he forbare <S%H2308><s%> to go forth <S%H3318><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> in strong holds <S%H4679><s%>, and remained <S%H3427><s%> in a mountain <S%H2022><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Ziph <S%H2128><s%>. And Saul <S%H7586><s%> sought <S%H1245><s%> him every day <S%H3117><s%>, but God <S%H430><s%> delivered <S%H5414><s%> him not into his hand <S%H3027><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that Saul <S%H7586><s%> was come out <S%H3318><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> his life <S%H5315><s%>: and David <S%H1732><s%> was in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Ziph <S%H2128><s%> in a wood <S%H2793><s%>.

And Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%>'s son <S%H1121><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%>, and went <S%H3212><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%> into the wood <S%H2793><s%>, and strengthened <S%H2388><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> in God <S%H430><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H3372><s%>, Fear not <S%H3027><s%>: for the hand of Saul <S%H7586><s%> my father <S%H1><s%> shall not find <S%H4672><s%> you <S%H4427><s%>; and you shall be king over Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and I shall be next <S%H4932><s%> unto you <S%H7586><s%>; and that also Saul my father <S%H1><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%>.

And they two <S%H8147><s%> made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>: and David <S%H1732><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the wood <S%H2793><s%>, and Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> to his house <S%H1004><s%>.

Then came up <S%H5927><s%> the Ziphites <S%H2130><s%> to Saul <S%H7586><s%> to Gibeah <S%H1390><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Does not David <S%H1732><s%> hide <S%H5641><s%> himself with us in strong holds <S%H4679><s%> in the wood <S%H2793><s%>, in the hill <S%H1389><s%> of Hachilah <S%H2444><s%>, which is on the south <S%H3225><s%> of Jeshimon <S%H3452><s%>?

Now therefore <S%H4428><s%>, O king, come down <S%H3381><s%> according to all the desire <S%H185><s%> of your soul <S%H5315><s%> to come down <S%H3381><s%>; and our part shall be to deliver <S%H5462><s%> him into the king <S%H4428><s%>'s hand <S%H3027><s%>.
And Saul <S%H7586><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Blessed <S%H1288><s%> be you of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>; for you have compassion on me <S%H2550><s%>.

Go <S%H3212><s%>, I pray you <S%H3559><s%>, prepare yet <S%H3045><s%>, and know and see <S%H7200><s%> his place <S%H4725><s%> where his haunt <S%H7272><s%> is <S%H7200><s%>, and who has seen him there <S%H559><s%>: for it is told me that he deals very <S%H6191><s%> subtly <S%H6191><s%>.

See <S%H7200><s%> therefore <S%H3045><s%>, and take knowledge of all the lurking places <S%H4224><s%> where he hides <S%H2244><s%> himself <S%H7725><s%>, and come you again to me with the certainty <S%H3559><s%>, and I will go <S%H1980><s%> with you <S%H3426><s%>: and it shall come to pass, if he be in the land <S%H776><s%>, that I will search <S%H2664><s%> him out throughout all the thousands <S%H505><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>.

And they arose <S%H6965><s%>, and went <S%H3212><s%> to Ziph <S%H2128><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%>: but David <S%H1732><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%> were in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Maon <S%H4584><s%>, in the plain <S%H6160><s%> on the south <S%H3225><s%> of Jeshimon <S%H3452><s%>.

Saul <S%H7586><s%> also and his men <S%H582><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> him <S%H5046><s%>. And they told David <S%H1732><s%>: why he came down <S%H3381><s%> into a rock <S%H5553><s%>, and lived <S%H3427><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Maon <S%H4584><s%>. And when Saul <S%H7586><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> that <S%H7291><s%>, he pursued after <S%H310><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Maon <S%H4584><s%>.

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> on this side <S%H6654><s%> of the mountain <S%H2022><s%>, and David <S%H1732><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%> on that side <S%H6654><s%> of the mountain <S%H2022><s%>: and David <S%H1732><s%> made hurry <S%H2648><s%> to get away <S%H3212><s%> for fear <S%H6440><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%>; for Saul <S%H7586><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%> surrounded <S%H5849><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%> round about <S%H5849><s%> to take them <S%H8610><s%>.

But there came <S%H935><s%> a messenger <S%H4397><s%> unto Saul <S%H7586><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Hurry <S%H4116><s%> you <S%H3212><s%>, and come; for the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> have invaded <S%H6584><s%> the land <S%H776><s%>.

That is why Saul <S%H7586><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> from pursuing <S%H7291><s%> after <S%H310><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>, and went <S%H3212><s%> against <S%H7125><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>: therefore they called <S%H7121><s%> that place <S%H4725><s%> Sela <S%H5555><s%>–hammahlekoth.
And David <S%H1732><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> from there <S%H3427><s%>, and lived in strong holds <S%H4679><s%> at En <S%H5872><s%>–gedi.
